DataElement.preferredName: Smoking PATH Cigar Risk Perception Questionnaire Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The act of puffing and/or inhaling smoke from a lit cigarette, cigar, or pipe._A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they?ve quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time._A compact roll of tobacco leaves prepared for smoking._The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus._A predetermined set of questions._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable._The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus._A predetermined set of questions.

Property.preferredName: Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study Cigar Risk Perception Questionnaire
Property.preferredDefinition: A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they've quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time.:A compact roll of tobacco leaves prepared for smoking.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.:The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus.:A predetermined set of questions.

Concepts.longName: Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study
Concepts.definition: A national longitudinal study of tobacco use and how it affects the health of people in the United States. It is designed to learn how and why people start using tobacco products, quit using them, and start using them again after they've quit, as well as how different tobacco products affect health outcomes over time.
A compact roll of tobacco leaves prepared for smoking.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

The process of producing an internal, conscious image through stimulating a sensory system; it involves the recognition that stimulation has occurred, and the ability to discriminate various aspects of the stimulus.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease
